question: <image 1>A student performs the photoelectric effect experiment and obtains the data depicted in the accompanying graph of E_{km} (maximum kinetic energy) of photoelectrons v. the frequency of the photons. What is the approximate work function of this material?
description: The image shows a graph with two axes: the x-axis represents the frequency of photons (f) in units of \(10^{14}\) Hz, and the y-axis represents the maximum kinetic energy (\(E_{km}\)) of photoelectrons in electron volts (eV). The graph displays a straight line that starts at a negative value on the y-axis and increases linearly as the frequency increases. The line intersects the x-axis at approximately \(4 \times 10^{14}\) Hz. This intersection point indicates the threshold frequency at which the photoelectric effect begins to occur for the given material.
